data.name: AliasesToExport_Description
data.value: A collection of the aliases to export from the module.

data.name: ClrVersion_Description
data.value: The CLR version that this module requires.

data.name: CmdletsToExport_Description
data.value: The cmdlets to export from the module.

data.name: CodeCertSettingDesc
data.value: Specifies the code signing certificate to use when signing scripts.

data.name: CompanyName_Description
data.value: The company name to specify for the module.

data.name: Copyright_Description
data.value: The copyright information for the module.

data.name: DotNetFrameworkVersion_Description
data.value: The .NET framework version requried by the module.

data.name: FailedToInstallDebugEngine
data.value: Failed to install and register the PowerGUI VSX debug engine. The first execution of this extension must be run as Administrator to allow a file to be copied to the PowerGUI installation directory and for it to be registered with Visual Studio. For more information see http:\\powerguivsx.codeplex.com. The error that was reported was [{0}].

data.name: FormatsToProcess_Description
data.value: The formats to process within the module.

data.name: FunctionsToExport_Description
data.value: Functions to export from the module.

data.name: Guid_Description
data.value: The unique identifier of the module.

data.name: ManifestFileName_Description
data.value: The file name of the manifest.

data.name: ModuleToProess_Description
data.value: Specifies the primary or "root" file of the module. When the module is imported, the members that are exported from the root module file are imported into the caller's session state. Enter the file name of one script module (.psm1) or binary module (.dll).

data.name: NestedModules_Description
data.value: Specifies script modules (.psm1) and binary modules (.dll) that are imported into the module's session state. The files in the NestedModules key run in the order in which they are listed in the value.

data.name: OutputDirectory_Description
data.value: The output directory to copy scripts after completing the build.

data.name: OutputTypeSettingDescription
data.value: Specifies whether to create a module manifest including the scripts in this project.

data.name: PowerShellHostName_Description
data.value: Specifies the name of the Windows PowerShell host program that the module requires. Enter the name of the host program, such as "Windows PowerShell ISE Host" or "ConsoleHost". Wildcards are not permitted.

data.name: PowerShellHostVersion_Description
data.value: Specifies the minimum version of the Windows PowerShell host program that works with the module. Enter a version number, such as 1.1.

data.name: PowerShellVersion_Description
data.value: Specifies the minimum version of Windows PowerShell that will work with this module. Enter 1.0 or 2.0. Requirements for versions greater than 2.0 are not enforced.

data.name: ProcessorArchitecture_Description
data.value: Specifies the processor architecture that the module requires. Valid values are x86, AMD64, IA64, and None (unknown or unspecified).

data.name: RequiredAssemblies_Description
data.value: Specifies the assembly (.dll) files that the module requires. Windows PowerShell loads the specified assemblies before updating types or formats, importing nested modules, or importing the module file that is specified in the value of the ModuleToProcess key.

data.name: RequiredModules_Description
data.value: Specifies modules that must be in the global session state. If the required modules are not in the global session state, attempts to import this module will fail.

data.name: ScriptsToProcess_Description
data.value: Specifies script (.ps1) files that run in the caller's session state when the module is imported. You can use these scripts to prepare an environment, just as you might use a login script.

data.name: SignOutputSettingDescription
data.value: Sign the scripts in this project with the specified certificate.

data.name: TypesToProcess_Description
data.value: Specifies the type files (.ps1xml) that run when the module is imported.

data.name: VariablesToExport_Description
data.value: Specifies the variables that the module exports. Wildcards are permitted.

data.name: Version_Description
data.value: Specifies the version of the module.

data.name: MissingPowerShellVersion
data.value:
PowerShell Tools for Visual Studio requires at least Windows Management Framework v3, which you do not have installed.
Would you like to download now?

data.name: ErrorFailToCreateProcess
data.value: Timed out to create and initialize the process {0}

data.name: ErrorPipelineBusy
data.value: Pipeline not executed because a pipeline is already executing. Pipelines cannot be executed concurrently.

data.name: MessageBoxErrorTitle
data.value: PowerShell Tools for Visual Studio Error

data.name: PowerShellHostInitializeFailed
data.value: Failed to initialize PowerShell host for PowerShell Tools

data.name: PowerShellHostInitializingNotComplete
data.value: PowerShell host initializing has not yet completed, please try again later.

data.name: PowerShellToolsInitializeFailed
data.value: Failed to initialize PowerShell Tools for Visual Studio

data.name: Error_DisallowedValue_1arg
data.value: This value is not one of the allowed values for parameter '{0}'.

data.name: ParameterEditorTipLabel
data.value: The following parameter values will be used for this execution

data.name: GoToDefinitionFailureMessage
data.value: Cannot navigate to the symbol under the caret.

data.name: GoToDefinitionAmbiguousMessage
data.value: Function definition is ambiguous. Navigated to first possible definition.

data.name: DropDownToolTip
data.value: Use the dropdown to view and navigate to other items in this file.

data.name: RemotePortDescription
data.value: Allows for debugging of a PowerShell script on a remote machine. Enter the name or address of the machine for which you wish to connect for the qualifier. Port 5986 is the default port but another may be specified. There is no need to specify a transport protocol type (http, tcp, etc.) or username. PowerShell v5.0+ must be installed on the remote machine. Requires a SSL certificate.

data.name: CleanupErrorMessage
data.value: PowerShell Tools is unable to detach from the process and may now be in an unstable state. You may need to restart Visual Studio.

data.name: AttachExistingAttachError
data.value: Cannot remotely debug a process while already attached to a process. Please detach from the currently attached process before trying again.

data.name: AttachExistingRemoteError
data.value: Cannot remotely debug a process while in a remote session. Please exit your remote session before trying again.

data.name: RemoteUnsecuredPortDescription
data.value: Allows for debugging of a PowerShell script on a remote machine. Enter the name or address of the machine for which you wish to connect for the qualifier. Port 5985 is the default port but another may be specified. There is no need to specify a transport protocol type (http, tcp, etc.) or username. PowerShell v5.0+ must be installed on the remote machine. Does not require a SSL certificate.

data.name: EnumRemoteVersionError
data.value: Unable to attach with current remote PowerShell version ({0}). Please ensure that PowerShell v5 or higher is installed.

data.name: Error_LocalScriptInRemoteSession
data.value: Local script ({0}) cannot be run through remote PowerShell session

data.name: Error_PipelineBusy
data.value: Pipeline not executed because a pipeline is already executing. Pipelines cannot be executed concurrently.

data.name: LocalHostRemoteDebugError
data.value: Cannot connect to the localhost with remote debugging. Use the default transport to attach to local processes.

data.name: ProcessAttachFailErrorBody
data.value: Unable to attach to specified process.
data.comment: Generic dialog box body for when attaching to a process fails

data.name: ProcessAttachVersionErrorBody
data.value: Unable to attach with current PowerShell version ({0}). Please ensure that PowerShell v5 or higher is installed.
data.comment: Dialog box body for invalid attempt at attaching on PowerShell v4 or below

data.name: ProcessDebugError
data.value: Error while attempting to debug the specified process.
data.comment: Error message given if an error occurs attempting to/while debugging the runspace

data.name: Warning_HigherVersionOnTargetRequiredForDebugging
data.value: Warning: PowerShell v4.0 or later is needed on your remote computer to debug during remote script execution. You can install the latest PowerShell from: {0}

data.name: Warning_HigherVersionRequiredForDebugging
data.value: Warning: PowerShell v4.0 or later is needed to debug during remote script execution. You can install the latest PowerShell from: {0}

data.name: UnexpectedError
data.value: Unexpected error! Failed to run tests!
